meanings.definition: The area of land along the edge of a body of water, typically a beach.
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic on the beachfront, enjoying the view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The beachfront is where the sand meets the water, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls on the beachfront were having a party, squawking and dancing around.
meanings.sent4: The beachfront stretched out like a welcoming carpet, inviting us to relax and unwind.
meanings.sent5: The beachfront sparkled under the sun, beckoning us to come closer and feel the sand between our toes.

meanings.definition: Located on or near the edge of a beach.
meanings.sent1: The beachfront hotel offered stunning views of the ocean from every room.
meanings.sent2: Living in a beachfront house means you can hear the waves crashing at night.
meanings.sent3: The beachfront restaurant served seafood so fresh, it practically swam to your plate.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a beachfront sunrise, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The beachfront breeze carried the scent of salt and adventure, filling our lungs with excitement.
